thread.title: Police tape off notorious 'dogging' site in forest after man is found critically injured
thread.title_full: Police tape off notorious 'dogging' site in forest after man is found critically injured

author: Scott Campbell
title: Police tape off notorious 'dogging' site in forest after man is found critically injured
text:
News Police tape off notorious 'dogging' site in forest after man is found critically injured Detectives have launched a major investigation and are keeping an "open mind" after the 45-year-old was spotted at Hollow Ponds in Snaresbrook, east London Share Police have sealed off the area Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Police have taped off a notorious 'dogging' spot in a forest after a man was found critically injured. 
Detectives have launched a major investigation after the 45-year-old was spotted at Hollow Ponds in Snaresbrook on Thursday afternoon. 
The woods were still taped off on Saturday morning with police telling Mirror Online the man is "critical" in a central London hospital . 
Officers say they are keeping an "open mind" over the circumstances but refused to reveal the nature of his condition. Read More 
The Hollow Ponds forest is notorious among local residents as a meeting spot for casual sex - with 'doggers' leaving used condoms and rubbish strewn across the woods. The woods are notorious among local residents Hollow Ponds in Snaresbrook (Photo: Alamy) 
Anyone with information about the unconscious man is asked to contact detectives at Waltham Forest CID on 101 or via Twitter @MetCC. Read More Chilling CCTV shows killer buying 'burial kit' before wrapping victim in tarpaulin and dumping him in shallow grave 
A London Ambulance spokeswoman added: “We sent an ambulance crew and a single responder in a car to the scene. 
“We treated a patient at the scene and took them as a priority to a hospital in east London.” Like us on Facebook
